3.value: An elegant Victorian-era compound microscope featuring brass construction and fine mechanical adjustments. This instrument represents the pinnacle of 19th-century optical craftsmanship, with multiple objective lenses and a rotating turret for magnification changes. The microscope includes original specimen slides and accessories in a fitted mahogany case.

8.value: Very good condition for its age. All mechanical parts function smoothly. Minor brass tarnishing consistent with age. All lenses are clear and free from scratches. Original case shows some wear but remains structurally sound with intact hinges and clasps.
